column3:
Great!

I see one mistake in the screenshot though: en (or generally, xx without xx_YY) should be simply English, not English - UnitedStates :)
@laanwj I'm not sure how to fix your observation, as I pass "en" into QLocale and query `.language()` and `.country()`. Perhaps UnitedStates is default here? As Germany is for de?\n

Yes, I know that's the behavior. But it's not correct. English is "general" English, without locale. You can see this problem with Persian - Iran, which is now duplicate in the list. I wonder if there is another way to take apart the xx_YY which doesn't have this problem (without reinventing the wheel...).\n
We could check if there is a "_" in the source string and if not only use `.language()`? Do you know the function to check for a certain char in a QString?\n
@laanwj Thanks, it now does, what we want it to do.\n
